metadata.title: CVE-2022-40318 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in bgpd in FRRouting (FRR) through 8.4. By craftinga BGP OPEN message with an option of type 0xff (Extended Length from RFC9072), attackers may cause a denial of service (assertion failure anddaemon restart, or out-of-bounds read). This is possible because ofinconsistent boundary checks that do not account for reading 3 bytes(instead of 2) in this 0xff case. NOTE: this behavior occurs inbgp_open_option_parse in the bgp_open.c file, a different location (with adifferent attack vector) relative to CVE-2022-40302.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-40318` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

frr - 7.2.1-1ubuntu0.2
frr-pythontools - 7.2.1-1ubuntu0.2
frr-rpki-rtrlib - 7.2.1-1ubuntu0.2
frr-snmp - 7.2.1-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: frr package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.2.1-1ubuntu0.2').
